HBAR and $DOT  highlight where infra is heading.  $HBAR  continues gaining relevance in enterprise-grade networks, settlement, and real-world utility, showing how regulated environments are moving onchain.  DOT focuses on interoperability, letting specialized chains communicate without living in isolated silos.  Both point to the same direction: networks matter more when capital and applications can move freely.  Thatâ€™s where Hemi fits in.  Hemi continues strengthening its position among YZi-backed networks by extending this infrastructure thinking to Bitcoin, allowing BTC to participate in DeFi, yield, and applications without leaving its security model.  As interoperability and real-world use expand, Bitcoin becoming usable capital is the missing layer.  Hemi is positioning Bitcoin inside that future.  #Altcoin Season#  #DeFi

A huge shift in $DOT   Polkadot is firmly in the products era, with everything from an upcoming mobile app, to gaming infrastructure and huge AI plays.  They have managed to spend the last year scaling in all major verticals and have taken all this work to pivot into putting users first.  With upgrades like Elastic Scaling and JAM protocol and a focus on stablecoin usage and privacy, Polkadot are in prime position to stand out in current market challenges.  #Macro Insights#

Gavin Wood, co-founder of Polkadot, recapped the network's major achievements in 2025. âšªï¸ A pivotal milestone was shifting core user functionsâ€”like DOT holdings, staking mechanisms, and voting processesâ€”from the Relay Chain to the Polkadot Hub. This seamless migration handled roughly 1.6 billion DOT across over 1.5 million user accounts, all without interrupting network operations.  âšªï¸ The Hub has emerged as the core hub for handling transactions, oversight, and executing smart contracts.  âšªï¸ The year's tech innovations centered on JAM and the PolkaVM runtime: introducing a flexible computation framework with seamless Ethereum Virtual Machine integration.  âšªï¸ Meanwhile, $DOT   economic model saw refinements, including lower issuance rates and a cap on total supply at around 2.1 billion tokens.  â˜‘ï¸ Polkadot's 2026 agenda shifts gears from backend upgrades to prioritizing user-facing applications and enhanced experiences. #dot
